Articles.Content: If they're using star dates, we'll be waiting decades!
Red 5 standing by... until after work...

Just started school. Should be out around 12:00 for me.

(Twitch.....twitch) must contain...... Antisipatioooonnn!

Poker face... Poker face

Edit: this is my 200th post!

Ya 200!

Edited December 17, 2013 by Tidus Klein

If they're using star dates, we'll be waiting decades!

I would say centuries since star dates are only implemented from the early 23th century,as for the steam question,for me it was more to be able to download KSP off the site onto a computer that doesn't have steam installed
Time remaining until forum will likely be crash: 4 hours and 40 minutes. Everyone waiting for the updates! it will be fun watching it.
Working & waiting, really excited for the improved science stuff.

Inteeeeense waiting times..

Quick question, for the mods; I have a Steam install of KSP. Should I remove all the mods (from the steamapps directory) or let them in? What is the "safer" way?
I'm wondering to start my youtube lp from 0 again or wait untill the mods are updated & do an intermediate series
...I don't even care. Won't be able to play it till Friday.
Damnit if i only had a timewarp button
I think save your save files from steam directory than re install KSP to have a nice and clean copy. This is the best way to reduce the chance of bugs and errors before the update.

I would kerb my enthusiasm for 0.23 but it's not tweakable yet.

Am i the only one who thinks this comment is hilarious?
Checking in.
+1 for the hottest thread on the forums
Still at school. Only one hour to go before getting home. Excepting .23 in 9 hours or something like that.

I think it is about... 6 am. in Mexico?

I assume they'll release it somewhere near 8 o'clock int he morning, zulu time, so that's a couple of hours left to wait.

I think it is about... 6 am. in Mexico?

I assume they'll release it somewhere near 8 o'clock int he morning, zulu time, so that's a couple of hours left to wait.

That assumption should not be set in stone though last time we were in the same boat,we knew the date but not the actual hour

I think save your save files from steam directory than re install KSP to have a nice and clean copy. This is the best way to reduce the chance of bugs and errors before the update.

Thanks. Sounds like a plan !
Central Time FTW

I just siting here and refresh the forum for some kind of sign.

Are we there yet? - No.

Are we there yet? - No.

Are we there yet? - No.

Are we there yet? - No.

Are we there yet? - Yes.

Really? - NO!

Or for those of us who were kids in the late '80's early '90's in Flanders & the Netherlands

'We zijn er bijna,we zijn er bijna maar nog niet helemaal'

Meaning

We're almost there, We're almost there but not entirely
